list.author: Benjamin Cardozo

list.text:
The human mind treats a new idea the way the body treats a strange
protein -- it rejects it.
list.author: P. Medawar

list.text: The human race never solves any of its problems.  It merely outlives them.
list.author: David Gerrold

list.text: The idle mind knows not what it is it wants.
list.author: Quintus Ennius

list.text: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The kind of danger people most enjoy is the kind they can watch from
a safe place.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The knowledge that makes us cherish innocence makes innocence unattainable.
list.author: Irving Howe

list.text: The last time I saw him he was walking down Lover's Lane holding his own hand.
list.author: Fred Allen

list.text:
The Least Successful Defrosting Device
	The all-time record here is held by Mr. Peter Rowlands of Lancaster
whose lips became frozen to his lock in 1979 while blowing warm air on it.
	"I got down on my knees to breathe into the lock.  Somehow my lips
got stuck fast."
	While he was in the posture, an old lady passed an inquired if he
was all right.  "Alra?  Igmmlptk", he replied at which point she ran away.
	"I tried to tell her what had happened, but it came out sort of...
muffled," explained Mr. Rowlands, a pottery designer.
	He was trapped for twenty minutes ("I felt a bit foolish") until
constant hot breathing brought freedom.  He was subsequently nicknamed "Hot
Lips".
list.author: Stephen Pile, "The Book of Heroic Failures"

list.text:
The Lord prefers common-looking people.  That is the reason that He makes
so many of them.
list.author: Abraham Lincoln

list.text: The louder he talked of his honour, the faster we counted our spoons.
list.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

list.text:
The major advances in civilization are processes that all but wreck the
societies in which they occur.
list.author: A.N. Whitehead

list.text: The man who raises a fist has run out of ideas.
list.author: H.G. Wells, "Time After Time"

list.text:
The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two
chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
list.author: Carl Jung

list.text: The minute a man is convinced that he is interesting, he isn't.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The mirror sees the man as beautiful, the mirror loves the man; another
mirror sees the man as frightful and hates him; and it is always the same
being who produces the impressions.
list.author: Marquis D.A.F. de Sade

list.text: The more I know men the more I like my horse.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The more I see of men the more I admire dogs.
list.author: Mme De Sevigne, 1626-1696

list.text: The more we disagree, the more chance there is that at least one of us is right.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The most disagreeable thing that your worst enemy says to your face does
not approach what your best friends say behind your back.
list.author: Alfred De Musset

list.text: The most hopelessly stupid man is he who is not aware that he is wise.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The nice thing about egotists is that they don't talk about other people.
list.author: Lucille S. Harper

list.text: The odds are a million to one against your being one in a million.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The older a man gets, the farther he had to walk to school as a boy.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age
brings wisdom.
list.author: H.L. Mencken

list.text:
The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint
has a past and every sinner has a future.
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text: The only really decent thing to do behind a person's back is pat it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The only rose without thorns is friendship.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The only thing to do with good advice is pass it on.  It is never any
use to oneself.
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text:
The only two things that motivate me and that matter to me are revenge
and guilt.
list.author: Elvis Costello

list.text: The only way to amuse some people is to slip and fall on an icy pavement.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text: The opposite of talking isn't listening.  The opposite of talking is waiting.
list.author: Fran Lebowitz, "Social Studies"

list.text: The part of the world that people find most puzzling is the part called "Me".
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The people sensible enough to give good advice are usually sensible
enough to give none.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The perfect friend sees the best in you -- sees it constantly -- not just
when you occasionally are that way, but also when you waver, when you
forget yourself, act like less than you are. In time, you become more
like his vision of you -- which is the person you have always wanted to be.
list.author: Nancy Friday

list.text:
The point is, you see, that there is no point in driving yourself mad
trying to stop yourself going mad.  You might just as well give in and
save your sanity for later.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
... the privileged being which we call human is distinguished from
other animals only by certain double-edged manifestations which in
charity we can only call "inhuman."
list.author: R. A. Lafferty

list.text:
The probability of someone watching you is proportional to the
stupidity of your action.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can
be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues.
list.author: Elizabeth Taylor

list.text:
The propriety of some persons seems to consist in having improper
thoughts about their neighbours.
list.author: F.H. Bradley

list.text:
The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one
persists in trying to adapt the world to himself.  Therefore all progress
depends on the unreasonable man.
list.author: George Bernard Shaw

list.text:
The right half of the brain controls the left half of the body.  This
means that only left handed people are in their right mind.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: "The Schizophrenic: An Unauthorized Autobiography"
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The second best policy is dishonesty.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The secret of happiness is total disregard of everybody.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The shifts of Fortune test the reliability of friends.
list.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

list.text: The strong give up and move away, while the weak give up and stay.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The strong individual loves the earth so much he lusts for recurrence.  He
can smile in the face of the most terrible thought: meaningless, aimless
existence recurring eternally.  The second characteristic of such a man is
that he has the strength to recognise -- and to live with the recognition --
that the world is valueless in itself and that all values are human ones.
He creates himself by fashoning his own values; he has the pride to live
by the values he wills.
list.author: Nietzsche

list.text:
The sudden sight of me causes panic in the streets. They have yet to learn
-- only the savage fears what he does not understand.
list.author: The Silver Surfer

list.text:
The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher
esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
list.author: Nietzsche

list.text: The things that interest people most are usually none of their business.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The three questions of greatest concern are -- 1. Is it attractive?
2. Is it amusing?  3. Does it know its place?
list.author: Fran Lebowitz, "Metropolitan Life"

list.text:
The trouble with telling a good story is that it invariably reminds
the other fellow of a dull one.
list.author: Sid Caesar

list.text: The truth about a man lies first and foremost in what he hides.
list.author: Andre Malraux

list.text: The very remembrance of my former misfortune proves a new one to me.
list.author: Miguel de Cervantes

list.text: The way of the world is to praise dead saints and prosecute live ones.
list.author: Nathaniel Howe

list.text: The way some people find fault, you'd think there was some kind of reward.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The way to a man's heart is through the left ventricle.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The wise man seeks everything in himself; the ignorant man tries to get
everything from somebody else.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The wise shepherd never trusts his flock to a smiling wolf.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The wonderful thing about a dancing bear is not how well he dances,
but that he dances at all.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The world is full of people who have never, since childhood, met an
open doorway with an open mind.
list.author: E.B. White

list.text: The world needs more people like us and fewer like them.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The worst cliques are those which consist of one man.
list.author: G.B. Shaw

list.text: The worst is not so long as we can say "This is the worst."
list.author: King Lear

list.text: The worst part of having success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
list.author: Bette Midler

list.text:
The worst sin towards our fellow creatures is not to hate them,
but to be indifferent to them; that's the essence of inhumanity.
list.author: G.B. Shaw

list.text: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
list.author: William Butler Yeats

list.text:
The worst thing one can do is not to try, to be aware of what one wants and
not give in to it, to spend years in silent hurt wondering if something could
have materialized -- and never knowing.
list.author: David Viscott

list.text:
Then there's the story of the man who avoided reality for 70 years
with drugs, sex, alcohol, fantasy, TV, movies, records, a hobby, lots of
sleep...  And on his 80th birthday died without ever having faced any of
his real problems.
	The man's younger brother, who had been facing reality and all his
problems for 50 years with psychiatrists, nervous breakdowns, tics, tension,
headaches, worry, anxiety and ulcers, was so angry at his brother for having
gotten away scott free that he had a paralyzing stroke.
	The moral to this story is that there ain't no justice that we can
stand to live with.
list.author: R. Geis

list.text:
There are few people more often in the wrong than those who cannot endure
to be thought so.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
There are many people today who literally do not have a close personal
friend.  They may know something that we don't.  They are probably
avoiding a great deal of pain.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There are more dead people than living, and their numbers are increasing.
list.author: Eugene Ionesco

list.text: There are no emotional victims, only volunteers.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There are no great men, buster.  There are only men.
list.author: Elaine Stewart, "The Bad and the Beautiful"

list.text:
There are no great men, only great challenges that ordinary men are forced
by circumstances to meet.
list.author: Admiral William Halsey

list.text: There are only two kinds of men -- the dead and the deadly.
list.author: Helen Rowland

list.text:
There are people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the
truth without lying.
list.author: Josh Billings

list.text:
There are two types of people in this world, good and bad.  The good
sleep better, but the bad seem to enjoy the waking hours much more.
list.author: Woody Allen

list.text: There comes a time to stop being angry.
list.author: A Small Circle of Friends

list.text:
There is a certain frame of mind to which a cemetery is, if not an antidote,
at least an alleviation.  If you are in a fit of the blues, go nowhere else.
	--Robert Louis Stevenson: Immortelles
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
There is an innocence in admiration; it is found in those to whom it
has not yet occurred that they, too, might be admired some day.
list.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

list.text:
There is brutality and there is honesty.  There is no such thing as brutal
honesty.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There is no delight the equal of dread.  As long as it is somebody else's.
list.author: Clive Barker

list.text: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There is no statute of limitations on stupidity.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There is no substitute for good manners, except, perhaps, fast reflexes.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
There is no such thing as inner peace.  There is only nervousness or death.
Any attempt to prove otherwise constitutes unacceptable behaviour.
list.author: Fran Lebowitz, "Metropolitan Life"

list.text: There is nothing more silly than a silly laugh.
list.author: Gaius Valerius Catullus

list.text:
There is nothing stranger in a strange land than the stranger who comes
to visit.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
There is only one word for aid that is genuinely without strings,
and that word is blackmail.
list.author: Colm Brogan

list.text:
There may be said to be two classes of people in the world; those who constantly
divide the people of the world into two classes and those who do not.
list.author: Robert Benchley

list.text: There's a fine line between courage and foolishness.  Too bad it's not a fence.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There's a lot to be said for not saying a lot.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There's no saint like a reformed sinner.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There's no such thing as pure pleasure; some anxiety always goes with it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Therefore it is necessary to learn how not to be good, and to use
this knowledge and not use it, according to the necessity of the cause.
list.author: Machiavelli

list.text: They also serve who only stand and wait.
list.author: John Milton

list.text:
They are ill discoverers that think there is no land, when they can see
nothing but sea.
list.author: Francis Bacon

list.text: "They told me I was gullible ... and I believed them!"
list.author: Unknow

list.text: They're only trying to make me LOOK paranoid!
list.author: Unknow

list.text: "They're unfriendly, which is fortunate, really.  They'd be difficult to like."
list.author: Avon

list.text: Thinking you know something is a sure way to blind yourself.
list.author: Frank Herbert, "Chapterhouse: Dune"

list.text: This generation doesn't have emotional baggage.  We have emotional moving vans.
list.author: Bruce Feirstein

list.text:
This sad little lizard told me that he was a brontosaurus on his mother's
side.  I did not laugh; people who boast of ancestry often have little
else to sustain them.  Humoring them costs nothing and adds happiness in
a world in which happiness is always in short supply.
list.author: Lazarus Long

list.text: Those of you who think you know everything are annoying those of us who do.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Those who are mentally and emotionally healthy are those who have
learned when to say yes, when to say no and when to say whoopee.
list.author: W.S. Krabill

list.text: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
list.author: George Santayana

list.text: Those who don't know, talk.  Those who don't talk, know.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Those who in quarrels interpose, must often wipe a bloody nose.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To any truly impartial person, it would be obvious that I am always right.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To be great is to be misunderstood.
list.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

list.text: To be is to be related.
list.author: C.J. Keyser.

list.text: To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To be who one is, is not to be someone else.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
To be wise, the only thing you really need to know is when to say
"I don't know."
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
To believe your own thought, to believe that what is true for
you in your private heart is true for all men -- that is genius.
list.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

list.text:
To criticize the incompetent is easy; it is more difficult to criticize
the competent.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
To doubt everything or to believe everything are two equally convenient
solutions; both dispense with the necessity of reflection.
list.author: H. Poincar' e

list.text: To find a friend one must close one eye; to keep him -- two.
list.author: Norman Douglas

list.text: To keep your friends treat them kindly; to kill them, treat them often.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To laugh at men of sense is the privilege of fools.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To make an enemy, do someone a favor.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: To refuse praise is to seek praise twice.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
To stay young requires unceasing cultivation of the ability to unlearn
old falsehoods.
list.author: Lazarus Long, "Time Enough For Love"

list.text:
To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what
he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to do.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Too clever is dumb.
list.author: Ogden Nash

list.text: Troglodytism does not necessarily imply a low cultural level.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Truly great madness can not be achieved without significant intelligence.
list.author: Henrik Tikkanen

list.text: Try to be the best of whatever you are, even if what you are is no good.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Try to divide your time evenly to keep others happy.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
list.author: Alan Watts

list.text:
Uh-oh -- I've let the cat out of the bag.  Let me, then, straightforwardly
state the thesis I shall now elaborate: Making variations on a theme is
really the crux of creativity.
list.author: Douglas R. Hofstadter, "Metamagical Themas"

list.text: Unless you love someone, nothing else makes any sense.
list.author: e.e. cummings

list.text:
Vila: "I think I have just made the biggest mistake of my life."
Orac: "It is unlikely.  I would predict there are far greater mistakes
      waiting to be made by someone with your obvious talent for it."
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Violence stinks, no matter which end of it you're on.  But now and then
there's nothing left to do but hit the other person over the head with a
frying pan.  Sometimes people are just begging for that frypan, and if we
weaken for a moment and honor their request, we should regard it as
impulsive philanthropy, which we aren't in any position to afford, but
shouldn't regret it too loudly lest we spoil the purity of the deed.
list.author: Tom Robbins

list.text:
Virtue does not always demand a heavy sacrifice -- only the willingness
to make it when necessary.
list.author: Frederick Dunn

list.text:
Virtue is its own punishment.
Righteous people terrify me ... virtue is its own punishment.
list.author: Aneurin Bevan

list.text: Virtue is not left to stand alone.  He who practices it will have neighbors.
list.author: Confucius

list.text: Virtue would go far if vanity did not keep it company.
list.author: La Rochefoucauld

list.text: Visits always give pleasure: if not on arrival, then on the departure.
list.author: Edouard Le Berquier, "Pensees des Autres"

list.text:
Waking a person unnecessarily should not be considered a capital crime.
For a first offense, that is.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Walk softly and carry a BFG-9000.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Walk softly and carry a big stick.
list.author: Theodore Roosevelt

list.text: Walk softly and carry a megawatt laser.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We all dream of being the darling of everybody's darling.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We all know that no one understands anything that isn't funny.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We all live under the same sky, but we don't all have the same horizon.
list.author: Dr. Konrad Adenauer

list.text: We are all born mad.  Some remain so.
list.author: Samuel Beckett

list.text: We are all dying -- and we're gonna be dead for a long time.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text: We are all so much together and yet we are all dying of loneliness.
list.author: A. Schweitzer

list.text: We are anthill men upon an anthill world.
list.author: Ray Bradbury

list.text: We ARE as gods and might as well get good at it.
list.author: Whole Earth Catalog

list.text: We are each only one drop in a great ocean -- but some of the drops sparkle!
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
We are not loved by our friends for what we are; rather, we are loved in
spite of what we are.
list.author: Victor Hugo

list.text: We are so fond of each other because our ailments are the same.
list.author: Jonathon Swift

list.text:
We are stronger than our skin of flesh and metal, for we carry and share a
spectrum of suns and lands that lends us legends as we craft our immortality
and interweave our destinies of water and air, leaving shadows that gather
color of their own, until they outshine the substance that cast them.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
list.author: La Rochefoucauld

list.text:
We have more to fear from the bungling of the incompetent than from the
machinations of the wicked.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
We lie loudest when we lie to ourselves.
	-- Eric Hoffer
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
We may not return the affection of those who like us, but we always respect
their good judgement.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
We only acknowledge small faults in order to make it appear that we are
free from great ones.
list.author: La Rouchefoucauld

list.text:
We prefer to believe that the absence of inverted commas guarantees the
originality of a thought, whereas it may be merely that the utterer has
forgotten its source.
list.author: Clifton Fadiman, "Any Number Can Play"

list.text: We prefer to speak evil of ourselves rather than not speak of ourselves at all.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We promise according to our hopes, and perform according to our fears.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We read to say that we have read.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
We really don't have any enemies.  It's just that some of our best
friends are trying to kill us.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: We secure our friends not by accepting favors but by doing them.
list.author: Thucydides

list.text: We seldom repent talking too little, but very often talking too much.
list.author: Jean de la Bruyere

list.text:
We thrive on euphemism.  We call multi-megaton bombs "Peace-keepers", closet
size apartments "efficient" and incomprehensible artworks "innovative".  In
fact, "euphemism" has become a euphemism for "bald-faced lie".  And now, here
are the euphemisms so colorfully employed in Personal Ads:
EUPHEMISM			REALITY
-------------------		-------------------------
Excited about life's journey	No concept of reality
Spiritually evolved		Oversensitive
Moody				Manic-depressive
Soulful				Quiet manic-depressive
Poet				Boring manic-depressive
Sultry/Sensual			Easy
Uninhibited			Lacking basic social skills
Unaffected and earthy		Slob and lacking basic social skills
Irreverent			Nasty and lacking basic social skills
Very human			Quasimodo's best friend
Swarthy				Sweaty even when cold or standing still
Spontaneous/Eclectic		Scatterbrained
Flexible			Desperate
Aging child			Self-centered adult
Youthful			Over 40 and trying to deny it
Good sense of humor		Watches a lot of television
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Well, I'm disenchanted too.  We're all disenchanted.
list.author: James Thurber

list.text:
Were it not for the presence of the unwashed and the half-educated, the
formless, queer and incomplete, the unreasonable and absurd, the infinite
shapes of the delightful human tadpole, the horizon would not wear so wide
a grin.
list.author: F.M. Colby, "Imaginary Obligations"

list.text:
What do I consider a reasonable person to be?  I'd say a reasonable person
is one who accepts that we are all human and therefore fallible, and takes
that into account when dealing with others.  Implicit in this definition is
the belief that it is the right and the responsibility of each person to
live his or her own life as he or she sees fit, to respect this right in
others, and to demand the assumption of this responsibility by others.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: What good is it if you talk in flowers, and they think in pastry?
list.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

list.text:
What is involved in such [close] relationships is a form of emotional
chemistry, so far unexplained by any school of psychiatry I am aware of, that
conditions nothing so simple as a choice between the poles of attraction and
repulsion.  You can meet some people thirty, forty times down the years, and
they remain amiable bystanders, like the shore lights of towns that a sailor
passes at stated times but never calls at on the regular run.  Conversely,
all considerations of sex aside, you can meet some other people once or twice
and they remain permanent influences on your life.
	Everyone is aware of this discrepancy between the acquaintance seen
as familiar wallpaper or instant friend.  The chemical action it entails is
less worth analyzing than enjoying.  At any rate, these six pieces are about
men with whom I felt an immediate sympat - to use a coining of Max Beerbohm's
more satisfactory to me than the opaque vogue word "empathy".
list.author: Alistair Cooke, "Six Men"

list.text:
What is tolerance? -- it is the consequence of humanity.  We are all formed
of frailty and error; let us pardon reciprocally each other's folly -- that
is the first law of nature.
list.author: Voltaire

list.text:
What makes us so bitter against people who outwit us is that they think
themselves cleverer than we are.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: What on earth would a man do with himself if something did not stand in his way?
list.author: H.G. Wells

list.text:
What upsets me is not that you lied to me, but that from now on I can no
longer believe you.
list.author: Nietzsche

list.text: What we see depends on mainly what we look for.
list.author: John Lubbock

list.text:
What you see is from outside yourself, and may come, or not, but is beyond
your control.  But your fear is yours, and yours alone, like your voice, or
your fingers, or your memory, and therefore yours to control.  If you feel
powerless over your fear, you have not yet admitted that it is yours, to do
with as you will.
list.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley, "Stormqueen"

list.text:
What's the matter with the world?  Why, there ain't but one thing wrong
with every one of us -- and that's "selfishness."
list.author: The Best of Will Rogers

list.text:
What's this stuff about people being "released on their own recognizance"?
Aren't we all out on our own recognizance?
list.author: Unknow

list.text: What, after all, is a halo?  It's only one more thing to keep clean.
list.author: Christopher Fry

list.text:
Whatever you may be sure of, be sure of this: that you are dreadfully like
other people.
list.author: James Russell Lowell, "My Study Windows"

list.text: Whatever you want to do, you have to do something else first.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
When a man knows he is to be hanged in a fortnight, it concentrates his
mind wonderfully.
list.author: Samuel Johnson

list.text:
When a man you like switches from what he said a year ago, or four years
ago, he is a broad-minded man who has courage enough to change his mind
with changing conditions.  When a man you don't like does it, he is a
liar who has broken his promises.
list.author: Franklin Adams

list.text: When all other means of communication fail, try words.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: When among apes, one must play the ape.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: When God endowed human beings with brains, He did not intend to guarantee them.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: When in doubt, do it.  It's much easier to apologize than to get permission.
list.author: Grace Murray Hopper

list.text: When it comes to helping you, some people stop at nothing.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: When people say nothing, they don't necessarily mean nothing.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
When there are two conflicting versions of the story, the wise course
is to believe the one in which people appear at their worst.
list.author: H. Allen Smith, "Let the Crabgrass Grow"

list.text: When you dig another out of trouble, you've got a place to bury your own.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
When you jump for joy, beware that no-one moves the ground from beneath
your feet.
list.author: Stanislaw Lem, "Unkempt Thoughts"

list.text:
When you speak to others for their own good it's advice;
when they speak to you for your own good it's interference.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
When you try to make an impression, the chances are that is the
impression you will make.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
WHENEVER ANYBODY SAYS he's struggling to become a human being I have to
laugh because the apes beat him to it by about a million years.  Struggle
to become a parrot or something.
list.author: Jack Handley, The New Mexican, 1988.

list.text: Whenever I feel like exercise, I lie down until the feeling passes.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text:
Whenever someone tells you to take their advice, you can be pretty sure
that they're not using it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
... whether it is better to spend a life not knowing what you want or to
spend a life knowing exactly what you want and that you will never have it.
list.author: Richard Shelton

list.text:
While anyone can admit to themselves they were wrong, the true test is
admission to someone else.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: While having never invented a sin, I'm trying to perfect several.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
While most peoples' opinions change, the conviction of their
correctness never does.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: While we are sleeping, two-thirds of the world is plotting to do us in.
list.author: Dean Rusk

list.text:
While you don't greatly need the outside world, it's still very
reassuring to know that it's still there.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
While your friend holds you affectionately by both your hands you are
safe, for you can watch both of his.
list.author: Ambrose Bierce, "The Devil's Dictionary"

list.text:
Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not
become a monster.  And when you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks
into you.
list.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

list.text: Whoever would lie usefully should lie seldom.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Why be difficult when, with a bit of effort, you could be impossible?
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Why did the Lord give us so much quickness of movement unless it was to
avoid responsibility with?
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Why my thoughts are my own, when they are in, but when they are out they
are another's.
		 -- Susanna Martin, executed for witchcraft, 1681
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Why was I born with such contemporaries?
list.author: Oscar Wilde

list.text: Why, every one as they like; as the good woman said when she kissed her cow.
list.author: Rabelais

list.text:
Will your long-winded speeches never end?
What ails you that you keep on arguing?
list.author: Job 16:3

list.text:
Winter is the season in which people try to keep the house as warm as
it was in the summer, when they complained about the heat.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
With a gentleman I try to be a gentleman and a half, and with a fraud I
try to be a fraud and a half.
list.author: Otto von Bismark

list.text: With clothes the new are best, with friends the old are best.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Words must be weighed, not counted.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Worrying is like rocking in a rocking chair -- It gives you something to do,
but it doesn't get you anywhere.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Write a wise saying and your name will live forever.
list.author: Anonymous

list.text:
Ye've also got to remember that ... respectable people do the most astonishin'
things to preserve their respectability.  Thank God I'm not respectable.
list.author: Ruthven Campbell Todd

list.text: Yes, but every time I try to see things your way, I get a headache.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Yield to Temptation ... it may not pass your way again.
list.author: Lazarus Long, "Time Enough for Love"

list.text: You ain't learning nothing when you're talking.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You are a wish to be here wishing yourself.
list.author: Philip Whalen

list.text: You are absolute plate-glass. I see to the very back of your mind.
list.author: Sherlock Holmes

list.text:
You are not a fool just because you have done something foolish --
only if the folly of it escapes you.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You can always tell luck from ability by its duration.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You can always tell the people that are forging the new frontier.
They're the ones with arrows sticking out of their backs.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You can bear anything if it isn't your own fault.
list.author: Katharine Fullerton Gerould

list.text: You can destroy your now by worrying about tomorrow.
list.author: Janis Joplin

list.text: You can't carve your way to success without cutting remarks.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You can't cheat an honest man.  Never give a sucker an even break or
smarten up a chump.
list.author: W.C. Fields

list.text: You can't cross a large chasm in two small jumps.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You can't erase a dream, you can only wake me up.
list.author: Peter Frampton

list.text: You can't have your cake and let your neighbor eat it too.
list.author: Ayn Rand

list.text: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.
list.author: Booker T. Washington

list.text:
You can't learn too soon that the most useful thing about a principle
is that it can always be sacrificed to expediency.
list.author: W. Somerset Maugham, "The Circle"

list.text: You can't play your friends like marks, kid.
list.author: Henry Gondorf, "The Sting"

list.text:
You can't start worrying about what's going to happen.  You get spastic
enough worrying about what's happening now.
list.author: Lauren Bacall

list.text: "You can't teach people to be lazy - either they have it, or they don't."
list.author: Dagwood Bumstead

list.text: You cannot achieve the impossible without attempting the absurd.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You cannot kill time without injuring eternity.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You cannot propel yourself forward by patting yourself on the back.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
list.author: Indira Gandhi

list.text: You cannot use your friends and have them too.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You could get a new lease on life -- if only you didn't need the first
and last month in advance.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You don't have to be nice to people on the way up if you're not planning on
coming back down.
list.author: Oliver Warbucks, "Annie"

list.text: You don't have to explain something you never said.
list.author: Calvin Coolidge

list.text:
You give me space to belong to myself yet without separating me 
from your own life.  May it all turn out to your happiness.
list.author: Goethe

list.text:
You got to be very careful if you don't know where you're going,
because you might not get there.
list.author: Yogi Berra

list.text: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.
list.author: John Viscount Morley

list.text: You humans are all alike.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You just wait, I'll sin till I blow up!
list.author: Dylan Thomas

list.text: You know how to win a victory, Hannibal, but not how to use it.
list.author: Maharbal

list.text:
You know it's going to be a bad day when you want to put on the clothes
you wore home from the party and there aren't any.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You know it's going to be a long day when you get up, shave and shower,
start to get dressed and your shoes are still warm.
list.author: Dean Webber

list.text: You know it's Monday when you wake up and it's Tuesday.
list.author: Garfield

list.text: You know what they say -- the sweetest word in the English language is revenge.
list.author: Peter Beard

list.text: You know you are getting old when you think you should drive the speed limit.
list.author: E.A. Gilliam

list.text:
You know you're in trouble when...
(1)	You wake up face down on the pavement.
(2)	Your wife wakes up feeling amorous and you have a headache.
(3)	You turn on the news and they're showing emergency routes
		out of the city.
(4)	Your twin sister forgot your birthday.
(5)	You wake up and discover your waterbed broke and then
		remember that you don't have a waterbed.
(6)	Your doctor tells you you're allergic to chocolate.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You know you're in trouble when...
(1)	You've been at work for an hour before you notice that your 
		skirt is caught in your pantyhose.
		Especially if you're a man.
(2)	Your blind date turns out to be your ex-wife.
(3)	Your income tax check bounces.
(4)	You put both contact lenses in the same eye.
(5)	Your wife says, "Good morning, Bill" and your name is George.
(6)	You wake up to the soothing sound of flowing water... the day
		after you bought a waterbed.
(7)	You go on your honeymoon to a remote little hotel and the desk
		clerk, bell hop, and manager have a "Welcome Back" party 
		for your spouse.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You know you're in trouble when...
(1)	Your car horn goes off accidentally and remains stuck as you
		follow a group of Hell's Angels on the freeway.
(2)	You want to put on the clothes you wore home from the party 
		and there aren't any.
(3)	Your boss tells you not to bother to take off your coat.
(4)	The bird singing outside your window is a buzzard.
(5)	You wake up and your braces are locked together.
(6)	Your mother approves of the person you're dating.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You know you're in trouble when...
(1)	Your only son tells you he wishes Anita Bryant would mind 
		her own business.
(2)	You put your bra on backwards and it fits better.
(3)	You call Suicide Prevention and they put you on hold.
(4)	You see a `60 Minutes' news team waiting in your office.
(5)	Your birthday cake collapses from the weight of the candles.
(6)	Your 4-year old reveals that it's "almost impossible" to 
		flush a grapefruit down the toilet.
(7)	You realize that you've memorized the back of the cereal box.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You know your apartment is small...
	when you can't know its position and velocity at the same time.
	you put your key in the lock and it breaks the window.
	you have to go outside to change your mind.
	you can vacuum the entire place using a single electrical outlet.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You may be sure that when a man begins to call himself a "realist," he
is preparing to do something he is secretly ashamed of doing.
list.author: Sydney Harris

list.text: You may easily play a joke on a man who likes to argue -- agree with him.
list.author: Ed Howe

list.text:
You men out there probably think you already know how to dress for success.
You know, for example, that you should not wear leisure suits or white
plastic belts and shoes, unless you are going to a costume party disguised
as a pig farmer vacationing at Disney World.
list.author: Dave Barry, "How to Dress for Real Success"

list.text:
You must know that a man can have only one invulnerable loyalty, loyalty
to his own concept of the obligations of manhood.  All other loyalties
are merely deputies of that one.
list.author: Nero Wolfe

list.text: You never gain something but that you lose something.
list.author: Thoreau

list.text: You never get a second chance to make a first impression.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You never go anywhere without your soul.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You never know what is enough until you know what is more than enough.
list.author: William Blake

list.text: You never learn anything by doing it right.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You probably wouldn't worry about what people think of you if you could
know how seldom they do.
list.author: Olin Miller.

list.text:
"You say there are two types of people?"
	"Yes, those who separate people into two groups and those that don't."
	"Wrong.  There are three groups:
		Those who separate people into three groups.
		Those who don't separate people into groups.
		Those who can't decide."
	"Wait a minute, what about people who separate people into two groups?"
	"Oh.  Okay, then there are four groups."
	"Aren't you then separating people into four groups?"
	"Yeah."
	"So then there's a fifth group, right?"
	"You know, the problem is these idiots who can't make up their minds."
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You see things; and you say "Why?"
But I dream things that never were; and I say "Why not?"
		[No, it wasn't J.F. Kennedy.  Ed.]
list.author: George Bernard Shaw, "Back to Methuselah"

list.text: You shall judge of a man by his foes as well as by his friends.
list.author: Joseph Conrad

list.text: You should avoid hedging, at least that's what I think.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
You should make a point of trying every experience once -- except
incest and folk-dancing.
list.author: A. Bax, "Farewell My Youth"

list.text:
You shouldn't wallow in self-pity.  But it's OK to put your feet in it
and swish them around a little.
list.author: Guindon

list.text:
You want to know why I kept getting promoted?  Because my mouth knows more
than my brain.
	-- W.G.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: You won't skid if you stay in a rut.
list.author: Frank Hubbard

list.text:
You'd best be snoozin', 'cause you don't be gettin' no work done at 5 a.m.
anyway.
list.author: From the wall of the Wurster Hall stairwell

list.text: You'd better smile when they watch you, smile like you're in control.
list.author: Smile, "Was (Not Was)"

list.text: You're always thinking you're gonna be the one that makes 'em act different.
list.author: Woody Allen, "Manhattan"

list.text: You're either part of the solution or part of the problem.
list.author: Eldridge Cleaver

list.text: You're never too old to become younger.
list.author: Mae West

list.text: You've always made the mistake of being yourself.
list.author: Eugene Ionesco

list.text:
You've been telling me to relax all the way here, and now you're telling
me just to be myself?
list.author: The Return of the Secaucus Seven

list.text:
Young men are fitter to invent than to judge; fitter for execution than for
counsel; and fitter for new projects than for settled business.  For the
experience of age, in things that fall within the compass of it, directeth
them; but in new things, abuseth them.  The errors of young men are the ruin
of business; but the errors of aged men amount but to this, that more might
have been done, or sooner.  Young men, in the conduct and management of
actions, embrace more than they can hold; stir more than they can quiet; fly
to the end, without consideration of the means and degrees; pursue some few
principles which they have chanced upon absurdly; care not how they innovate,
which draws unknown inconveniences; and, that which doubleth all errors, will
not acknowledge or retract them; like an unready horse, that will neither stop
nor turn.  Men of age object too much, consult too long, adventure too little,
repent too soon, and seldom drive business home to the full period, but
content themselves with a mediocrity of success.  Certainly, it is good to
compound employments of both ... because the virtues of either age may correct
the defects of both.
list.author: Francis Bacon, "Essay on Youth and Age"

list.text: Young men think old men are fools; but old men know young men are fools.
list.author: George Chapman

list.text: Young men, hear an old man to whom old men hearkened when he was young.
list.author: Augustus Caesar

list.text:
Your Co-worker Could Be a Space Alien, Say Experts
		...Here's How You Can Tell
Many Americans work side by side with space aliens who look human -- but you
can spot these visitors by looking for certain tip-offs, say experts. They
listed 10 signs to watch for:
    (3) Bizarre sense of humor.  Space aliens who don't understand
	earthly humor may laugh during a company training film or tell
	jokes that no one understands, said Steiger.
    (6) Misuses everyday items.  "A space alien may use correction
	fluid to paint its nails," said Steiger.
    (8) Secretive about personal life-style and home.  "An alien won't
	discuss details or talk about what it does at night or on weekends."
   (10) Displays a change of mood or physical reaction when near certain
	high-tech hardware.  "An alien may experience a mood change when
	a microwave oven is turned on," said Steiger.
The experts pointed out that a co-worker would have to display most if not
all of these traits before you can positively identify him as a space alien.
	[I thought everybody laughed at company training films.  Ed.]
list.author: National Enquirer, Michael Cassels, August, 1984.

list.text:
Your conscience never stops you from doing anything.  It just stops you
from enjoying it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your
acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
list.author: Richard Bach, "Illusions"

list.text:
Youth -- not a time of life but a state of mind... a predominance of
courage over timidity, of the appetite for adventure over the love of ease.
list.author: Robert F. Kennedy

list.text: Youth is a blunder, manhood a struggle, old age a regret.
list.author: Benjamin Disraeli, "Coningsby"

list.text: Youth is a disease from which we all recover.
list.author: Dorothy Fuldheim

list.text:
Youth is not a time of life, it is a state of mind; it is a temper of
the will, a quality of the imagination, a vigor of the emotions, a predominance
of courage over timidity, of the appetite for adventure over love of ease.
	Nobody grows old by merely living a number of years; people grow
old only by deserting their ideals.  Years wrinkle the skin, but to give up
enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.  Worry, doubt, self-distrust, fear, and despair
-- these are the long, long years that bow the head and turn the growing spirit
back to dust.
	Whether seventy or sixteen, there is in every being's heart the love
of wonder, the sweet amazement at the stars and the starlike things and
thoughts, the undaunted challenge of events, the unfailing childlike appetite
for what next, and the joy and the game of life.
	You are as young as your faith, as old as your doubt; as young as your
self-confidence, as old as your fear, as young as your hope, as old as your
despair.
	So long as your heart receives messages of beauty, cheer, courage,
grandeur and power from the earth, from man, and from the Infinite, so long
you are young.
list.author: Samuel Ullman

list.text: A door is what a dog is perpetually on the wrong side of.
list.author: Ogden Nash

list.text:
A little dog goes into a saloon in the Wild West, and beckons to
the bartender.  "Hey, bartender, gimme a whiskey."
	The bartender ignores him.
	"Hey bartender, gimme a whiskey!"
	Still ignored.
	"HEY BARMAN!!  GIMME A WHISKEY!!"
	The bartender takes out his six-shooter and shoots the dog in the
leg, and the dog runs out the saloon, howling in pain.
	Three years later, the wee dog appears again, wearing boots,
jeans, chaps, a Stetson, gun belt, and guns.  He ambles slowly into the
saloon, goes up to the bar, leans over it, and says to the bartender,
"I'm here t'git the man that shot muh paw."
list.author: Unknow

list.text: About the only thing on a farm that has an easy time is the dog.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All intelligent species own cats.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Any member introducing a dog into the Society's premises shall be
liable to a fine of one pound.  Any animal leading a blind person shall
be deemed to be a cat.
list.author: Rule 46, Oxford Union Society, London

list.text: Anyone who considers protocol unimportant has never dealt with a cat.
list.author: R. Heinlein

list.text:
"Anything else you wish to draw to my attention, Mr. Holmes ?"
	"The curious incident of the stable dog in the nighttime."
	"But the dog did nothing in the nighttime."
	"That was the curious incident."
list.author: A. Conan Doyle, "Silver Blaze"

list.text:
Auribus teneo lupum.
	[I hold a wolf by the ears.]
	[Boy, it *sounds* good.  But what does it *mean*?]
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Breeding rabbits is a hare raising experience.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
list.author: Garrison Keillor

list.text:
Cats are smarter than dogs.  You can't make eight cats pull a sled through
the snow.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Cats, no less liquid than their shadows, offer no angles to the wind.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Chihuahuas drive me crazy.  I can't stand anything that shivers when it's warm.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
"Contrary to popular belief, penguins are not the salvation of modern
technology.  Neither do they throw parties for the urban proletariat."
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Did you ever walk into a room and forget why you walked in?  I think
that's how dogs spend their lives.
list.author: Sue Murphy

list.text: Does the name Pavlov ring a bell?
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Dogs just don't seem to be able to tell the difference between important people
and the rest of us.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Everyone *knows* cats are on a higher level of existence.  These silly humans
are just to big-headed to admit their inferiority.
	Just think what a nicer world this would be if it were controlled by
cats.
	You wouldn't see cats having waste disposal problems.
	They're neat.
	They don't have sexual hangups.  A cat gets horny, it does something
about it.
	They keep reasonable hours.  You *never* see a cat up before noon.
	They know how to relax.  Ever heard of a cat with an ulcer?  
	What are the chances of a cat starting a nuclear war?  Pretty neglible.
It's not that they can't, they just know that there are much better things to
do with ones time.  Like lie in the sun and sleep.  Or go exploring the world.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: For a man to truly understand rejection, he must first be ignored by a cat.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Hi!  You have reached 555-0129. None of us are here to answer the phone and
the cat doesn't have opposing thumbs, so his messages are illegible.  Please
leave your name and message after the beep...
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
I loathe people who keep dogs.  They are cowards who haven't got the guts
to bite people themselves.
list.author: August Strindberg

list.text:
I love dogs, but I hate Chihuahuas.  A Chihuahua isn't a dog.  It's a rat
with a thyroid problem.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If a can of Alpo costs 38 cents, would it cost $2.50 in Dog Dollars?
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
If anyone has seen my dog, please contact me at x2883 as soon as possible.
We're offering a substantial reward.  He's a sable collie, with three legs,
blind in his left eye, is missing part of his right ear and the tip of his
tail.  He's been recently fixed.  Answers to "Lucky".
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
If you are a police dog, where's your badge?
		   crazy.
list.author: Question James Thurber used to drive his German Shepherd

list.text:
"If you don't want your dog to have bad breath, do what I do:  Pour a little
Lavoris in the toilet."
list.author: Jay Leno

list.text:
If you have received a letter inviting you to speak at the dedication of a
new cat hospital, and you hate cats, your reply, declining the invitation,
does not necessarily have to cover the full range of your emotions.  You must
make it clear that you will not attend, but you do not have to let fly at cats.
The writer of the letter asked a civil question; attack cats, then, only if
you can do so with good humor, good taste, and in such a way that your answer
will be courteous as well as responsive.  Since you are out of sympathy with
cats, you may quite properly give this as a reason for not appearing at the
dedication ceremonies of a cat hospital.  But bear in mind that your opinion
of cats was not sought, only your services as a speaker.  Try to keep things
straight.
list.author: Strunk and White, "The Elements of Style"

list.text: In the eyes of my dog, I'm a man.
list.author: Martin Mull

list.text: It is not a good omen when goldfish commit suicide.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: It was Penguin lust... at its ugliest.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: It's no use crying over spilt milk -- it only makes it salty for the cat.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Lost: gray and white female cat.  Answers to electric can opener.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Never try to outstubborn a cat.
list.author: Lazarus Long, "Time Enough for Love"

list.text:
No animal should ever jump on the dining room furniture unless
absolutely certain he can hold his own in conversation.
list.author: Fran Lebowitz

list.text: No one can feel as helpless as the owner of a sick goldfish.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: PENGUINICITY!!
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Raising pet electric eels is gaining a lot of current popularity.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: "Shelter," what a nice name for for a place where you polish your cat.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be
chewed and digested.
	[As anyone who has ever owned a puppy already knows.  Ed.]
list.author: Francis Bacon

list.text:
Sometimes when I get up in the morning, I feel very peculiar.  I feel
like I've just got to bite a cat!  I feel like if I don't bite a cat
before sundown, I'll go crazy!  But then I just take a deep breath and
forget about it.  That's what is known as real maturity.
list.author: Snoopy

list.text:
Speaking of purchasing a dog, never buy a watchdog that's on sale.
After all, everyone knows a bargain dog never bites!
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
The difference between dogs and cats is that dogs come when they're
called.  Cats take a message and get back to you.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: The main problem I have with cats is, they're not dogs.
list.author: Kevin Cowherd

list.text: The only time a dog gets complimented is when he doesn't do anything.
list.author: C. Schulz

list.text: There are many intelligent species in the universe, and they all own cats.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: There's no use in having a dog and doing your own barking.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
To err is human,
To purr feline.
list.author: Robert Byrne

list.text:
When man calls an animal "vicious", he usually means that it will attempt
to defend itself when he tries to kill it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
When the fog came in on little cat feet last night, it left these little
muddy paw prints on the hood of my car.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Who loves me will also love my dog.
list.author: John Donne

list.text: With a rubber duck, one's never alone.
list.author: "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy"

list.text:
(1) Everything depends.
(2) Nothing is always.
(3) Everything is sometimes.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A beginning is the time for taking the most delicate care that balances are
correct.
list.author: Princess Irulan, "Manual of Maud'Dib"

list.text: A bird in the bush usually has a friend in there with him.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
list.author: Cervantes

list.text: A bird in the hand is worth what it will bring.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A bird in the hand makes it awfully hard to blow your nose.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A boy spent years collecting postage stamps.  The girl next door bought
an album too, and started her own collection.  "Dad, she buys everything I've
bought, and it's taken all the fun out of it for me.  I'm quitting."  Don't,
son, remember, 'Imitation is the sincerest form of philately.'"
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A certain amount of opposition is a help, not a hindrance. Kites rise
against the wind, not with it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A chicken is an egg's way of producing more eggs.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A chronic disposition to inquiry deprives domestic felines of vital qualities.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A clever prophet makes sure of the event first.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A closed mouth gathers no foot.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A couch is as good as a chair.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A day without orange juice is like a day without orange juice.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A day without sunshine is like a day without Anita Bryant.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A day without sunshine is like a day without orange juice.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A day without sunshine is like night.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A dead man cannot bite.
list.author: Gnaeus Pompeius (Pompey)

list.text: A farmer is a man outstanding in his field.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A farmer with extremely prolific hens posted the following sign.  "Free
Chickens.  Our Coop Runneth Over."
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A father gave his teen-age daughter an untrained pedigreed pup for
her birthday.  An hour later, when wandered through the house, he found her
looking at a puddle in the center of the kitchen.  "My pup," she murmured
sadly, "runneth over."
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A fool and his money are soon popular.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A fool and your money are soon partners.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A fool must now and then be right by chance.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.
list.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

list.text: A friend in need is a pest indeed.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A full belly makes a dull brain.
		[and the local candy machine man.  Ed]
list.author: Ben Franklin

list.text:
A girl spent a couple hours on the phone talking to her two best
friends, Maureen Jones, and Maureen Brown.  When asked by her father why she
had been on the phone so long, she responded "I heard a funny story today
and I've been telling it to the Maureens."
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A gleekzorp without a tornpee is like a quop without a fertsneet (sort of).
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A good memory does not equal pale ink.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A good name lost is seldom regained.  When character is gone,
all is gone, and one of the richest jewels of life is lost forever.
list.author: J. Hawes

list.text: A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.
list.author: Patton

list.text: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
list.author: Publilius Syrus

list.text:
A good scapegoat is hard to find.
A guilty conscience is the mother of invention.
list.author: Carolyn Wells

list.text: A handful of friends is worth more than a wagon of gold.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A hermit is a deserter from the army of humanity.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A homeowner's reach should exceed his grasp, or what's a weekend for?
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A horse breeder has his young colts bottle-fed after they're three
days old.  He heard that a foal and his mummy are soon parted.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A hundred thousand lemmings can't be wrong!
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a cash advance.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
list.author: Lao Tsu

list.text: A journey of a thousand miles starts under one's feet.
list.author: Lao Tsu

list.text: A king's castle is his home.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A lie in time saves nine.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A lie is an abomination unto the Lord and a very present help in time of
trouble.
list.author: Adlai Stevenson

list.text: A likely impossibility is always preferable to an unconvincing possibility.
list.author: Aristotle

list.text: A little experience often upsets a lot of theory.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A little inaccuracy saves a world of explanation.
list.author: C.E. Ayres

list.text: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
list.author: H.H. Munro, "Saki"

list.text: A lost ounce of gold may be found, a lost moment of time never.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A man gazing at the stars is proverbially at the mercy of the puddles
in the road.
list.author: Alexander Smith

list.text:
A man who carries a cat by its tail learns something he can learn
in no other way.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A man with one watch knows what time it is.
A man with two watches is never quite sure.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A man's best friend is his dogma.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A man's house is his castle.
list.author: Sir Edward Coke

list.text: A man's house is his hassle.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A mind is a wonderful thing to waste.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A mushroom cloud has no silver lining.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A penny saved has not been spent.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A penny saved is ridiculous.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A pipe gives a wise man time to think and a fool something to stick in his
mouth.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A place for everything and everything in its place.
 
	[Quoted in "VMS Internals and Data Structures", V4.4, when
	 referring to memory management system services.]
list.author: Isabella Mary Beeton, "The Book of Household Management"

list.text: A platitude is simply a truth repeated till people get tired of hearing it.
list.author: Stanley Baldwin

list.text:
A plethora of individuals with expertise in culinary techniques contaminate
the potable concoction produced by steeping certain edible nutriments.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A plucked goose doesn't lay golden eggs.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A pound of salt will not sweeten a single cup of tea.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: "A radioactive cat has eighteen half-lives."
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A rolling stone gathers momentum.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
list.author: Publilius Syrus

list.text: A shortcut is the longest distance between two points.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A sinking ship gathers no moss.
list.author: Donald Kaul

list.text: A Smith & Wesson beats four aces.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A snake lurks in the grass.
list.author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

list.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath; but grievous words stir up anger.
list.author: Proverbs 15:1

list.text: A soft drink turneth away company.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A song in time is worth a dime.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A stitch in time saves nine.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A violent man will die a violent death.
list.author: Lao Tsu

list.text: A watched clock never boils.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A wise man can see more from a mountain top than a fool can from the bottom
of a well.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
A wise man can see more from the bottom of a well than a fool can from a
mountain top.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A wise person makes his own decisions, a weak one obeys public opinion.
list.author: Chinese proverb

list.text:
A witty saying proves nothing, but saying something pointless gets
people's attention.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: A witty saying proves nothing.
list.author: Voltaire

list.text: A word to the wise is enough.
list.author: Miguel de Cervantes

list.text: Above all else -- sky.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Above all things, reverence yourself.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Absence makes the heart forget.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Absence makes the heart go wander.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Absence makes the heart grow fonder -- of somebody else.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
list.author: Sextus Aurelius

list.text: Absence makes the heart grow frantic.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Absolutum obsoletum.  (If it works, it's out of date.)
list.author: Stafford Beer

list.text:
Ad astra per aspera.
	[To the stars by aspiration.]
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Adde parvum parvo manus acervus erit.
	[Add little to little and there will be a big pile.]
list.author: Ovid

list.text: Advice from an old carpenter: measure twice, saw once.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: After the game the king and the pawn go in the same box.
list.author: Italian proverb

list.text: Age and treachery will always overcome youth and skill.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Age before beauty; and pearls before swine.
list.author: Dorothy Parker

list.text: Aim for the moon.  If you miss, you may hit a star.
list.author: W. Clement Stone

list.text: Ain't no right way to do a wrong thing.
list.author: The Mad Dogtender

list.text: Alas, I am dying beyond my means.
list.author: Oscar Wilde [as he sipped champagne on his deathbed]

list.text: Alimony is the high cost of leaving.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All a man needs out of life is a place to sit 'n' spit in the fire.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All articles that coruscate with resplendence are not truly auriferous.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
-- All articles that coruscate with resplendence are not truly auriferous.
-- When there are visible vapors having the prevenience in ignited
	carbonaceous materials, there is conflagration.
-- Sorting on the part of mendicants must be interdicted.
-- A plethora of individuals wither expertise in culinary techniques vitiated
	the potable concoction produced by steeping certain coupestibles.
-- Eleemosynary deeds have their initial incidence intramurally.
-- Male cadavers are incapable of yielding testimony.
-- Individuals who make their abode in vitreous edifices would be well
	advised to refrain from catapulting projectiles.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
All I kin say is when you finds yo'self wanderin' in a peach orchard,
ya don't go lookin' for rutabagas.
list.author: Kingfish

list.text: All is fear in love and war.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All is well that ends well.
list.author: John Heywood

list.text: All that glitters has a high refractive index.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All that glitters is not gold; all that wander are not lost.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All things are possible, except for skiing through a revolving door.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All things being equal, you are bound to lose.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All true wisdom is found on T-shirts.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: All's well that ends.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
An aphorism is never exactly true; it is either a half-truth or
one-and-a-half truths.
list.author: Karl Kraus

list.text: An apple a day makes 365 apples a year.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: An apple every eight hours will keep three doctors away.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: An idle mind is worth two in the bush.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: An ounce of clear truth is worth a pound of obfuscation.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: An ounce of hypocrisy is worth a pound of ambition.
list.author: Michael Korda

list.text: An ounce of mother is worth a ton of priest.
list.author: Spanish proverb

list.text: "An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of purge."
list.author: Unknow

list.text: And tomorrow will be like today, only more so.
list.author: Isaiah 56:12, New Standard Version

list.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
list.author: Proverbs, 26:5

list.text:
Any great truth can -- and eventually will -- be expressed as a cliche --
a cliche is a sure and certain way to dilute an idea.  For instance, my
grandmother used to say, "The black cat is always the last one off the fence."
I have no idea what she meant, but at one time, it was undoubtedly true.
list.author: Solomon Short

list.text: Any philosophy that can be put "in a nutshell" belongs there.
list.author: Sydney J. Harris

list.text:
Any road followed to its end leads precisely nowhere.
Climb the mountain just a little to test it's a mountain.
From the top of the mountain, you cannot see the mountain.
list.author: Bene Gesserit proverb, "Dune"

list.text: Anything is possible on paper.
list.author: Ron McAfee

list.text: Anything is possible, unless it's not.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Anything that is worth doing has been done frequently.  Things hitherto
undone should be given, I suspect, a wide berth.
list.author: Max Beerbohm, "Mainly on the Air"

list.text: Anything worth doing is worth overdoing.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: As well look for a needle in a bottle of hay.
list.author: Miguel de Cervantes

list.text:
Ask not for whom the Bell tolls, and you will pay only the station-to-station
rate.
list.author: Howard Kandel

list.text:
Ask not for whom the telephone bell tolls...
if thou art in the bathtub, it tolls for thee.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Avoid cliches like the plague.  They're a dime a dozen.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Be both a speaker of words and a doer of deeds.
list.author: Homer

list.text: Be sure to evaluate the bird-hand/bush ratio.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Beggars should be no choosers.
list.author: John Heywood

list.text: Better dead than mellow.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Better hope you get what you want before you stop wanting it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Better late than never.
list.author: Titus Livius (Livy)

list.text: Better living a beggar than buried an emperor.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Better to be nouveau than never to have been riche at all.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.
list.author: motto of the Christopher Society

list.text: Better tried by twelve than carried by six.
list.author: Jeff Cooper

list.text: Beware of friends who are false and deceitful.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Beware of geeks bearing graft.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Call on God, but row away from the rocks.
list.author: Indian proverb

list.text: Charity begins at home.
list.author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

list.text: Cheap things are of no value, valuable things are not cheap.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely.
list.author: P.J. O'Rourke

list.text: Cleanliness is next to impossible.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Cogito cogito ergo cogito sum --
"I think that I think, therefore I think that I am."
list.author: Ambrose Bierce, "The Devil's Dictionary"

list.text: "Cogito ergo I'm right and you're wrong."
list.author: Blair Houghton

list.text: Curiosity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought her back.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Desist from enumerating your fowl prior to their emergence from the shell.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
list.author: Aesop

list.text: Do unto others before they undo you.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Do, or do not; there is no try.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Doing gets it done.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Don't get even -- get odd!
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Don't get mad, get even.
Don't get even, get jewelry.
list.author: Anonymous

list.text: Don't get mad, get interest.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Don't put off for tomorrow what you can do today because if you enjoy it today,
you can do it again tomorrow.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Eschew obfuscation.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Every path has its puddle.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Every silver lining has a cloud around it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Every solution breeds new problems.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Expedience is the best teacher.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills.
list.author: Minna Antrim, "Naked Truth and Veiled Allusions"

list.text: Familiarity breeds attempt.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Flattery will get you everywhere.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Flee at once, all is discovered.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
list.author: Alexander Pope

list.text: Forgive and forget.
list.author: Cervantes

list.text: Fortune and love befriend the bold.
list.author: Ovid

list.text: Fortune favors the lucky.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #12
	Those who can, do.  Those who can't, write the instructions.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #3
	Birds of a feather flock to a newly washed car.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
Fortune finishes the great quotations, #9
	A word to the wise is often enough to start an argument.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Freedom from incrustation of grime is contiguous to rectitude.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Genius is pain.
list.author: John Lennon

list.text: Given sufficient time, what you put off doing today will get done by itself.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
God gave man two ears and one tongue so that we listen twice as much as
we speak.
list.author: Arab proverb

list.text: Happiness adds and multiplies as we divide it with others.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Happiness is the greatest good.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Haste makes waste.
list.author: John Heywood

list.text: Have a nice day!
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Have a nice diurnal anomaly.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Have an adequate day.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He that bringeth a present, findeth the door open.
list.author: Scottish proverb.

list.text: He who fears the unknown may one day flee from his own backside.
list.author: Sinbad

list.text: He who fights and runs away lives to fight another day.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who foresees calamities suffers them twice over.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who has a shady past knows that nice guys finish last.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
He who has the courage to laugh is almost as much a master of the world
as he who is ready to die.
list.author: Giacomo Leopardi

list.text: He who hates vices hates mankind.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who hesitates is last.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who hesitates is sometimes saved.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs has not yet heard the bad news.
list.author: Bertolt Brecht

list.text: He who laughs last -- missed the punch line.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs last didn't get the joke.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs last hasn't been told the terrible truth.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs last is probably your boss.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs last usually had to have joke explained.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who laughs, lasts.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who lives without folly is less wise than he believes.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: He who makes a beast of himself gets rid of the pain of being a man.
list.author: Dr. Johnson

list.text: Honesty is the best policy, but insanity is a better defense.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: Honesty's the best policy.
list.author: Miguel de Cervantes

list.text:
Honi soit qui mal y pense.
	[Evil to him who evil thinks.]
list.author: Motto of the Order of the Garter (est. Edward III)

list.text: How sharper than a hound's tooth it is to have a thankless serpent.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: How you look depends on where you go.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: I am a man: nothing human is alien to me.
list.author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

list.text: I doubt, therefore I might be.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: I know on which side my bread is buttered.
list.author: John Heywood

list.text: I think, therefore I am... I think.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: I'll turn over a new leaf.
list.author: Miguel de Cervantes

list.text: If a fool persists in his folly he shall become wise.
list.author: William Blake

list.text: If anything can go wrong, it will.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If at first you do succeed, try to hide your astonishment.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If at first you don't succeed, destroy all evidence that you tried.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If at first you don't succeed, quit; don't be a nut about success.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If at first you don't succeed, redefine success.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again.
list.author: W.E. Hickson

list.text: If at first you don't succeed, you're doing about average.
list.author: Leonard Levinson

list.text: If happiness is in your destiny, you need not be in a hurry.
list.author: Chinese proverb

list.text: If I cannot bend Heaven, I shall move Hell.
list.author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

list.text: If in doubt, mumble.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If it heals good, say it.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If the shoe fits, it's ugly.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If the thunder don't get you, then the lightning will.
list.author: Unknow

list.text: If there is no wind, row.
list.author: Polish proverb

list.text: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.
list.author: Laurence J. Peter

list.text: If wishes were horses, then beggars would be thieves.
list.author: Unknow

list.text:
If you wish to be happy for one hour, get drunk.
If you wish to be happy for three days, get married.
If you wish to be happy for a month, kill your pig and eat it.
If you wish to be happy forever, learn to fish.
